text: - My name's Keith Groom.

I'm the worldwide Head of
Partner Strategy and Programs
for Microsoft Workloads on AWS.

My role is focused on working
with consulting partners
across the world that are focused
on migrating workloads to the cloud.

We believe AWS is the best
place to run these workloads
so we train partners on how to do this.

We show them to architecturally
set it up on AWS,

how to deal with licensing,
price their deals.
The innovation that AWS has,

we're constantly and it's
relentless innovation
and sometimes it's exhausting

but that's one of the
inspiring things about AWS.
AWS isn't for everybody.
If really takes a builder's mentality.

If you just want some
steady state kind of work,

we're probably not the
right place for you.
But if you're really interested in growing

and doing big things and
having lots of opportunity
to experiment and wanting to try and fail,
we're totally that place.
We are a place to build new things

and I'm entering my sixth
year with the company
and every year, it's been different.
Our key priorities have changed.
The initiatives have changed.

We are maturing and growing
a really large business
and thinking about how you take it
to the next level is really exciting.
And so I find there's lots of long term,
I never get sick of what I'm doing

'cause there's so much
opportunity for growth.
